title: Oven Roasted Potatoes Recipe
description: These crispy roasted potatoes flavored with olive oil, garlic, herbs, and red pepper flakes make a delicious family-pleasing potato side dish for any meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Potato Roasted Potato Recipes Oven Roasted Potatoes 4.7 (1,697) 1,180 Reviews 110 Photos Crispy roasted potatoes flavored with olive oil, garlic, and herbs. A pleasing potato side dish for any meal! Submitted by JMRYGH Updated on October 25, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 110 110 110 110 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 30 mins Total Time: 45 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ⅛ cup olive oil 1 tablespoon minced garlic ½ teaspoon dried basil ½ teaspoon dried marjoram ½ teaspoon dried dill weed ½ teaspoon dried thyme ½ teaspoon dried oregano ½ teaspoon dried parsley ½ teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes ½ teaspoon salt 4 large potatoes, peeled and cubed Directions Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F (245 degrees C). Combine oil, garlic, basil, marjoram, dill, thyme, oregano, parsley, pepper flakes, and salt in a large bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Stir in potatoes until evenly coated. Place potatoes in a single layer on a roasting pan or baking sheet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast in the preheated oven, turning occasionally to brown on all sides, until tender with crispy edges, about 20 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 2,098 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 289 Calories 7g Fat 53g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 289 % Daily Value * Total Fat 7g 9% Saturated Fat 1g 5% Sodium 304mg 13% Total Carbohydrate 53g 19% Dietary Fiber 4g 14% Total Sugars 4g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 32mg 36% Calcium 31mg 2% Iron 2mg 8% Potassium 972mg 21% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Oven Roasted Potatoes 01 of 110 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 110 Photo by  Nick Toombs 04/01/2025 The combination of seasonings were awesome. Even the kids liked it. I grilled mine on top of aluminum foil, not enclosed, and mixed it all before in a container shaking it to where everything was evenly coated.Oven would be great but the grill added smoke. Averaged 350* while I cooked the main and side dishes at the same time. 03 of 110 Photo by  Spencer Dickson 01/14/2024 Quick, easy, delicious! 04 of 110 Photo by  TrendyBread7742 12/23/2023 Easy and simple for a non-chefty person like me. Used fingerling potatoes instead and left out the dill and oregano cause we hate them.I will say it is a bit spicy. Which I don’t mind but next time I’ll omit the red pepper flake. The spice kinda overpowers the rest of the flavors. 05 of 110 Photo by  Barbara Milligan 05/08/2023 I halfed the dill and didn’t add salt at all since my hubby is on a sodium restriction. Perfect. I think I’ll do the whole tsp of dill as I didn’t notice it cooked? Will be making again as this was super flavorful and so easy to make. Thank you for the recipe JMRYGH. 5 star Yum. 06 of 110 Photo by  MadHouse 03/21/2021 It was good, but next time I think I’ll go a little easy on the crushed red pepper, just a little spicy for me!! 07 of 110 Photo by  Jenin Training 03/01/2021 08 of 110 Photo by  Matt Theus 02/12/2021 09 of 110 Photo by  David 11/12/2020 10 of 110 Photo by  Daisie 10/27/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Roast Potatoes 714 Ratings Herby Roasted Potato Wedges 87 Ratings Healthier Oven-Roasted Potatoes 218 Ratings Roasted New Red Potatoes 1,430 Ratings Easy Roasted Potatoes 42 Ratings How to Make Roasted Red Potatoes 121 Ratings Diamond-Cut Roast Potatoes 4 Ratings Early Morning Oven Roasted New Potatoes 168 Ratings Honey-Mustard Roasted Potatoes 42 Ratings Roasted Potatoes with Greens 433 Ratings Mustard-Dill Roasted Fingerling Potatoes 7 Ratings Zucchini with Chickpea and Mushroom Stuffing 179 Ratings Fried Zucchini 149 Ratings Zucchini Saute 182 Ratings Grilled Asparagus 868 Ratings Crispy Potato Wedges 30 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Stir in potatoes until evenly coated. Place potatoes in a single layer on a roasting pan or baking sheet. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Roast in the preheated oven, turning occasionally to brown on all sides, until tender with crispy edges, about 20 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Serve hot and enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
